alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:39AM CDT until May 08 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Missouri... James River at Galena affecting Stone County. For the James River Basin...including Boaz, Galena...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Galena. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Flood waters reach the floor of the 413 bridge over Railey Creek near the confluence with the James River south of the gage site. (946 FT MSL) At 27.0 feet, The highway 413 bridge over Railey Creek south of the gage site floods. (948 FT MSL) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CDT Friday was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.1 feet on 06/20/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued on or before Saturday morning at 845 AM CDT.
